name: Disable Remote Patterns
author: UXL Themes

sections.description:
A simple plugin to disable the loading of the remote block patterns from the WordPress pattern directory.

If you want to improve pattern inserter loading performance, have privacy concerns regarding loading remote assets, or just looking to reduce block pattern overload, and make your theme bundled patterns more discoverable, this is the plugin for you.

License

Licensed under the GNU General Public License v2.0,
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html
sections.installation:
From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’,
  2. Search for ‘disable remote patterns’ and install the plugin.
  3. Activate ‘Disable Remote Patterns’ from your Plugins page.

That’s it! No settings or complicated options.
Now when adding a pattern to your posts or pages, your site will not attempt to fetch and load the remote block patterns from WordPress.
sections.faq:
I have activated the plugin. Now what do I do?

Activating the plugin is all you need to do.

How do I re-enable the remote block patterns?

Simply deactivate the plugin and your site will once again load the remote WordPress block patterns.
sections.changelog:
**1.0.2 – March 2023
– Tested up to 6.2

1.0.1 – March 2022
– Compatibility with 5.9

1.0 – December 2021
– Initial release
